>Egg producers suspect bird flu is traveling through the air.
>
>After a disastrous Midwestern outbreak early this year, we tested that theory and found that where the wind blew, the virus followed.
>
>Vaccines could help, but the USDA hasnâ€™t approved them.

https://bsky.app/profile/did:plc:k4jt6heuiamymgi46yeuxtpt/post/3m74whoe4ik2q

This is posted on a proper news site (e.g. not The Onion) and not only did someone in the US decide to publish this; some of the replies are wild as well..

This is common knowledge right? That bird flu is airborne and that it might also affect humans.
